title.narrative: PK-OGB Making the Most of What We Know

description.narrative:
Youth Led Study Coordination: In five countries (Pakistan, Mali, Ethiopia, India and Nepal), a youth-led study will be implemented as a youth empowering activity to capture the perspectives of girls and young women on female adolescence and child marriage. At theheart of the youth-led study is the meaningful and central participation of young people in all phases of the study, from the identification of relevant learning questions to engagement with youth peers and reflection to feed into programme implementation. This youth-led study will therefore involve youth explorers, who will be trained and closely guided on exploring the broader challenges faced by young girls (and boys) on issues of adolescence and early marriage, both on their personal fight and on how their experience can best be integrated into programming. This will be done using Oxfam’s youth-led study approach and framework, a 10 week process in which youth explorers will be supported and coached throughout the trajectory by a Youth Led Study Coordinator to ensure that theyare given the tools to reach their full potential as youth explorers, and to ensure a safety mechanism when needed. The Youth-Led Study Coordinator will follow an online course to be trained in the study approach and framework.In five countries (Pakistan, Mali, Ethiopia, India and Nepal), a youth-led study will be implemented as a youth empowering activity to capture the perspectives of girlsand young women on female adolescence and child marriage. At the heart of theyouth-led study is the meaningful and central participation of young people in all phases of the study, from the identification of relevant learning questions to engagement with youth peers and reflection to feed into programme implementation. This youth-led study will therefore involve youth explorers, who will be trained and closely guided on exploring the broader challenges faced by young girls (and boys) on issues of adolescence and early marriage, both on their personal fight and on how their experience can best be integrated into programming. This will be done using Oxfam’s youth-led study approach and framework, a 10 week process in which youth explorers will be supported and coached throughout thetrajectory by a Youth Led Study Coordinator to ensure that they are given the tools to reach their full potential as youth explorers, and to ensure a safety mechanism when needed. The Youth-Led Study Coordinator will follow an online course to be trained in the study approach and framework.
Learning Spark Fund: 1) The MMWWK project from the More than Brides Alliance aims to generate knowledge and learning on ways to address the issue of Child Marriage. One component of the project is the Learning Exchange Facility, providing small participatory grants, through the Learning Spark Fund. Participation is open to individuals, groups and organisations working on or affected by the issue of Child Marriage. 2) Simavi, member of the MTBA Alliance, manages the Learning Spark Fund in the 9 countries where MMWWK project is implemented. The Grants are structured into three sizes: Spark ( up to EUR3,000), Community Skyrocket (between EUR3,000 and 6,000) and Fireworks (between EUR6,000 and 10,000) 3) Oxfam Pakistan is contracting Bedari as a LSF Country Partnerto help disbursing the funds to selected participant(s) in Pakistan, supporting the implementation of the learning exchange and collecting relevant supporting documents.

participating-org.narrative: Oxfam Great Britain is a member of Oxfam International, a confederation of independent national organisations working in more than 90 countries. Oxfam works on six goals that support the shared vision of a just world without poverty: help people claim their right to a better life; champion equal rights for women; saving lives, now and in the future; safeguard global food supplies; help people claim a fairer share of natural resources; and increase money for basic services. For 70 years, Oxfam has been running emergency responses, development projects and campaigning at the grass roots level to tackle poverty.

mailing-address.narrative: PO box 30919, 2500 GX The Hague, The Netherlands
